programme.title: Les maîtres de la peinture moderne
programme.desc: Raoul Dufy La trajectoire artistique de Raoul Dufy, qui accompagne les avant-gardes parisiennes du début du XXe siècle, en fait un peintre très original. Aquarelliste et dessinateur suggestif, il est aussi l'auteur d'une gigantesque décoration « La Fée Électricité » pour l'Exposition internationale de 1937 au musée d'Art moderne de Paris. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2019)

programme.title: Les Seychelles, un paradis écologique
programme.desc:
Their name alone seems to open the doors to paradise: the Seychelles. With the breathtaking beauty of their ocean floor, bird sanctuaries and major nature reserves, the archipelago in the Indian Ocean has made environmental protection a national duty. The Seychelles are pioneers in the world of ecotourism.

Directed by: Éric Bacos (France, 2022)

programme.title: Ma vie rurale
programme.desc: Episode 8 For Normandy vet Mélanie it's one emergency after another. In the Cher, Aurore celebrates the first anniversary of her business. In the Drôme, Audrey and Didier prepare for the next season: they're training a dog and cultivating new truffle oaks. In the Moselle, father and son launch an ambitious project. Directed by: Frédéric Martin (France, 2021)

programme.title: Embarquement
programme.desc: Flanders (Belgium) From fishing on horseback to the masterpieces of the Flemish primitive painters, as well as the Arboretum Tervuren, this is an invitation to discover Flanders, one of the three regions of Belgium. Directed by: Antonio Buscardini (Belgium, 2021)

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Sept-Îles, protecting the seabirds
Just offshore from Brittany's Côte de Granit Rose, the Sept-Îles archipelago is a nature reserve that offers a safe haven for the largest population of seabirds in metropolitan France. No easy matter, when we know that between 1950 and 2010, the global seabird population declined by nearly 70%. Report by: Corentin Pichon.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
The secret language of colours
Some eight million colours exist in the world. So why don't the colour-blind see them in the same way as everyone else? How does colour affect our taste and perception? Why is blue so popular? Jamy and his team explain how colours determine our relationship with the world.
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: L'art a du chien, et du chat...
programme.desc:
Dogs and cats feature prominently in most museums and art galleries. But why do artists feel so inspired by them? What do these artworks reveal about the link that connects these domestic animals and mankind?

Directed by: Anka Schmid (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In Le Touquet, with Arnaud Ducret
In Le Touquet, Mory Sacko offers scallops a delicious new twist, using them to prepare pèpè soup, a recipe from the Côte d'Ivoire. He is ably assisted by the actor Arnaud Ducret.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
The secret language of colours
Some eight million colours exist in the world. So why don't the colour-blind see them in the same way as everyone else? How does colour affect our taste and perception? Why is blue so popular? Jamy and his team explain how colours determine our relationship with the world.
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Sept-Îles, protecting the seabirds
Just offshore from Brittany's Côte de Granit Rose, the Sept-Îles archipelago is a nature reserve that offers a safe haven for the largest population of seabirds in metropolitan France. No easy matter, when we know that between 1950 and 2010, the global seabird population declined by nearly 70%. Report by: Corentin Pichon.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Les petites bulles
programme.desc: Land art This "Petite Bulle" is all about a special type of art. How to use nature to make a beautiful, ephemeral but respectful creation.

programme.title: Les contes de Lupin
programme.sub-title: Le petit bucheron et la gardienne de l'hiver

programme.title: Massi en mission
programme.desc: The astronaut David Saint-Jacques challenges the YouTuber Massi Mahiou to prepare for a future space mission. But how exactly do astronauts train? What sort of experiments do they carry out? How do they live with zero gravity? Massi discovers all he needs to know about the mission and about space.

programme.title: Rocky & Lily : c'est dans la boîte !
programme.desc:
Beware of the werewolf!
It's full moon: the moment when the werewolves are out and about! Given that he's always hungry, could it be that's Rocky a werewolf?
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In Le Touquet, with Arnaud Ducret
In Le Touquet, Mory Sacko offers scallops a delicious new twist, using them to prepare pèpè soup, a recipe from the Côte d'Ivoire. He is ably assisted by the actor Arnaud Ducret.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc: Périgord, a natural heritage Along the highways and byways of the Périgord, Ismaël heads towards Saint-Amand de Coly, officially listed as one of the most beautiful villages of France. He is accompanied by Aude, daughter of Hubert de Commarque and owner of the château, delighted to share her own favourite corners of the Périgord. Presented by: Ismaël Khelifa.

programme.title: Zwingli, le réformateur
programme.desc:
In the 16th century, Huldrych Zwingli, a Catholic priest from a humanist background condemns abuses within the Church. Unafraid of standing up to those in power, the influence of this prime mover in the Protestant Reformation in Zürich, a contemporary of Luther, spreads throughout the whole of German-speaking Switzerland.

Directed by: Stefan Haupt (Switzerland, 2019)

Cast: Max Simonischek, Anatole Taubman, Sarah Sophia Meyer

Genre: History

programme.title: Une autre histoire
programme.desc:
Episode 23
Vincent confides in Maryse, telling her that he has good reason not to trust Anémone. Meanwhile, completely unawares, the latter takes the risk of making a major step forwards... towards her past. Simon asks Naëlle the big question, but nothing goes quite as planned.
Directed by: Brigitte Couture (Canada, 2019) Cast: Marina Orsini (Anémone), Danielle Proulx (Lise), Sébastien Ricard (Vincent), Debbie Lynch-White (Caroline), Benoît McGinnis (Sébastien), Adam Kosh (Jean-Olivier), Mikhaïl Ahooja (Simon), Marilou Morin (Karla), Laurence Barrette (Olivia) Genre: drama

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 1: Blind-sided by fate
Marianne, Léon's mother has died. Now he has to move to Montreal to live with Francis, his biological father. Fortunately his grandfather Bernard will be at his side during this painful ordeal.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 2: Solid as a padlock
Léon visits his new secondary school to finalise his admission with the headmaster. Meanwhile Francis realises that he'll have to make some changes in the house to make life easier for Léon.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 3: Security above all
It's Léon's first day at school! His French teacher is convinced he'll be an asset for the class. Léon meets Florence, a pupil suffering from cystic fibrosis.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: De Gaulle, premières batailles
programme.desc:
17 May 1940, Montcornet, in the Aisne. At dawn the tanks of the 4th armoured division attack, commanded by a 49 year-old colonel, Charles de Gaulle. We look back at one of the founding events of the de Gaulle legend and the first major counter-offensive of the Second World War.

Directed by: Serge Tignères (France, 2019)
